column2: MARYLAND PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 2. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 3. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 4. Roads are most slippery:
column8: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 5. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 6. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
7. When preparing to drive, you should:
8. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 9. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 10. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
11. This sign means:
12. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 13. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column6: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
16. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
17. If you are approaching an emergency vehicle that is stopped on the road, you:
column4: must pull into an available lane not immediately adjacent to the emergency vehicle.
column6: must increase your speed to get around the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.
column8: may not pass the emergency vehicle.

column2: 18. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 19. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 20. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 21. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
22. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 23. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is not permitted in either direction.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
25. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
